#Text=U.S. launches airstrikes against Basra militants
#Text=Saturday , March 29 , 2008

#Text=United States warplanes dropped two bombs on a suspected militant stronghold in Basra Saturday , as the Iraqi offensive aimed at driving out Shiite militants from the city reached its fifth day .
#Text=An Iraqi policeman says that the U.S. airstrike on a house in Basra 's Hananiyah neighborhood killed 8 civilians .
#Text=The U.S. military has not yet commented on the policeman 's report , but British military spokesman Maj. Tom Holloway says the report is under investigation .
#Text=" We are aware of reports of incidents in the Basra area resulting in civilian casualties , " Holloway said .

column1: #Text=" We are investigating the reports and do not have any further details at this time . "
#Text=British troops joined the fighting in Basra on Saturday , firing artillery and providing air support .
#Text=Meanwhile , Shiite cleric and Mahdi Army leader Muqtada al-Sadr called on his followers to defy the Iraqi government , which has ordered the militants to surrender their weapons .
#Text=An initial 72-hour ultimatum was widely ignored , and the government has now given the militia until April 8 to give up their arms .

#Text=Salah al-Obaidi , a top aide to al-Sadr , said , " Muqtada al-Sadr has told us not to surrender our arms except to a state that can throw out the occupation , " referring to the U.S. occupation of Iraq .

#Text=In a speech today , Iraqi Prime Minister Nouri al-Maliki did not mention al-Sadr 's movement , and he said the purpose of the crackdown in Basra " was only to deal with these gangs " , some of whom , he says , are " worse than al-Qaeda " .
#Text=Other Iraqi officials have also insisted that the Mahdi Army was not the target of the offensive .
#Text=" Our determination is strong , " al-Maliki said .
#Text=" We will not leave Basra until security is restored , those who break the law are punished and those who draw their weapons in the face of the state are punished . "
#Text=Still , the crackdown has sparked a violent reaction from al-Sadr 's supporters , as well as Shiites in other areas of Iraq .
#Text=In Baghdad 's Sadr City neighborhood , a Shiite stronghold , Iraqi officials said that 75 people had been killed and nearly 500 were wounded in fighting between insurgents and security forces .
#Text=Two Americans were killed by a roadside bomb in east Baghdad Saturday .
#Text=Some of the policemen in Sadr City are influenced by al-Sadr and are sympathetic to his movement .
#Text=Around 40 Sadr City policemen handed over their weapons and ammunition to the Mahdi Army 's local office , wearing masks to shield their identities .
#Text=" We ca n't fight our brothers in the Mahdi Army , so we came here to submit our weapons , " one policeman said .
#Text=U.S. helicopters launched airstrikes in Sadr City on Friday night , which they say killed 10 militants .
#Text=This move was criticized by Nassar al-Rubaie , a Shiite member of Parliament .
#Text=" We condemn the government asking occupation forces to carry out airstrikes against our people , " he said .

column1: #Text=" We say Iraq sovereignty will not be achieved through military operation against Iraqis , as Bush claimed , but it can be achieved through throwing the occupation forces out of Iraq . "
